All skin, hair, nail, and associated illnesses are treated by the department of dermatology. We offer surgical, cosmetic, and paediatric dermatological services. Additionally, we specialize in the treatment of both common and complex dermatological conditions, including pemphigus, eczema, psoriasis, acne, and hair loss. Additionally, we provide medical hair transplant procedures and hair restoration treatments. With all these offerings, we are without a doubt the premier dermatological facility and the top option for skin care.

Skin cancer, eczema, shingles, acne, hair loss, shingles, and moles are among the conditions our Hope Hospital skin treatment specialists specialize in addressing. Leg ulcers, psoriasis, vaginal disorders, oral mucosal illnesses, and sexually transmitted infections are just a few of the conditions that our dermatologists are exceptionally skilled at treating. We also do vitiligo grafting to treat leucoderma (white patches) and stem cell therapy to treat vitiligo. For patients seeking therapy for glowing skin, Hope Hospital provides a holistic approach to care.

Why choose Hope Hospital for Dermatology?

The dermatologist at Hope Hospital and the rest of the health care team will collaborate with you to find the most effective method of treatment for your dermatologic concerns, regardless of whether they are medical or aesthetic in nature.

In order to give you the finest care and treatments possible, our team of doctors specialises in the diagnosis of complex skin illnesses and conducts research on cutting-edge therapies. For the efficient treatment of a wide range of skin disorders, skin cancer, and other dermatological issues, we have well-equipped labs with skilled doctors who use advanced conventional surgical techniques.

Conditions we treat

  • Psoriasis
  • Leg ulcers
  • Leucoderma
  • Hair loss
  • Shingles
  • Moles
  • Eczema
  • Acne
  • Alopecia
  • Blackheads

Treatments we provide

  • Excision surgery is the process of removing tissue from the body with a laser, scalpel, or other cutting instrument. Excision surgery is typically performed to remove lumps or other abnormal growths. Normally, some of the normal tissue surrounding the mass is also removed.
  • Dermato surgical procedures is a medical specialty that focuses on surgical operations and minimally invasive therapies to enhance skin health, function, and attractiveness.
  • Cryosurgery destroys cancer cells and aberrant tissue using liquid nitrogen or argon gas. Cryosurgery freezes tissue, killing cells. The doctor uses a cotton swab or spray to apply liquid nitrogen to skin tumors. Doctors may freeze tumor tissue with a cryoprobe.
  • Laser treatment By concentrating on a tiny area and causing less damage to the surrounding tissue than with traditional surgery, lasers in medicine enable surgeons to work with extreme precision.
  • Electrosurgery High-frequency electric currents are used during this procedure to precisely cut and heat tissue. In surgery, electrosurgery is a procedure that is frequently used to reduce bleeding and quickly dissect soft tissue.
  • Mole removal is intended to totally remove moles from the skin in a way that reduces scarring and gives a smooth, undetectable finish, and are different from mole biopsy.
  • Microdermabrasion is a minimally invasive procedure used to improve the general texture and tone of the skin. It can lessen the look of melasma, age spots, acne scars, fine lines, wrinkles, sun damage, and other skin-related issues.

Ways to keep healthy skin

  1. Every morning, before going to bed, and after perspiring, wash your face. When you wash your face when you wake up, you get rid of the dirt and bacteria that accumulated on it while you slept. You should wash off any makeup and filth, such as smoking, smog, or dirt, from your skin before going to bed.
  2. Look for skin cancer on your body. You can identify skin cancer early, when it’s still quite treatable, by performing skin self-exams. Make an appointment to see a dermatologist if you see a spot that is different from the others, or one that changes, itches, or bleeds.
  3. Refrain from rubbing your skin clean. Scrubbing your skin could seem normal if you’ve been perspiring a lot or have a severe case of acne. Don’t! Scrubbing causes skin irritation, which aggravates all skin conditions, including acne.
  4. Every day before you go outside, apply sunscreen. The closest thing we have to a fountain of youth is sunscreen. It genuinely has the power to delay skin aging It can aid in preventing skin cancer as well. A sunscreen with broad-spectrum protection, SPF 30 or greater, and water resistance is what you should seek out.
  5. Wash your face gently. Skin looks its finest after a gentle washing. Wet your face with warm water to gently cleanse it. Then use a gentle cleanser, gently rubbing it in with your fingertips in a circular motion. The cleanser should be completely rinsed out before gently wiping your skin dry with a fresh cloth.

 

What are the most typical skin issues?

Popular skin problems include psoriasis, acne, dry skin, contact dermatitis, moles, warts, fungal infections, and skin cancer.

 

When should I go see a dermatologist?

If there are any places on your skin that grow, change in size or color, itch, bleed, or refuse to heal, you should consult a dermatologist right once.

 

Skin cancer is treated by dermatologists? How is it handled?

Yes. The type of cancer will determine the sort of treatment needed. The amount of your surgery if you have a basal cell tumor will depend on your age, general health, the type, location, size, and depth of your tumor. Surgery is often used to remove basal cell carcinoma,melanoma and  squamous cell carcinoma

 

What exactly is psoriasis?

Psoriasis is an autoimmune condition that develops scaly, erythematous plaques on the skin, typically on the knees and elbows.

 

What brings on acne?

The hair follicle is inflamed in acne. Skin type,  Genetics, hormones, sebaceous oil production, and other variables are frequently to blame.

 

How Am I Supposed To Know If Skin Growth Is Dangerous?

Learn about your skin’s characteristics, including your unique pattern of moles, freckles, and beauty marks. Every two months or so, make sure to examine your entire body. Keep an eye out for variations in the quantity, scope, form, and hue of the pigmented patches. Changes in a mole’s surface; scaliness, seeping, bleeding, or the emergence of a new bump; the spread of a pigment from a mole’s border into the surrounding skin; and changes in sensation are among the warning signals to watch for (i.e., itchiness, tenderness, pain). Immediately consult a dermatologist if any changes are noticed.

 

Is skin cancer curable? What is the rate of success?

Skin cancer is a limited tumor, thus it can be cured if detected and treated early. In actuality, most patients recover fully from their initial surgery. 92% of people who are detected with skin cancer in its early stages will survive for five years. The likelihood of a successful treatment increases with earlier diagnosis.
